subject: RS
title: Religion and Peacebuilding
description: This course investigates the roles of religion and spirituality in peacemaking, exploring both obstacles and opportunities facing religious peace builders. Cases involving representatives of major world religions (Christianity, Islam, Judaism, Hinduism, and Buddhism) will provide a basis for comparing practices of faith-based advocacy for social justice, reconciliation, and coexistence. [Note: This course fulfils an Area 3 requirement for Religious Studies majors.]
